skill.name: debugging
skill.description: Four-phase debugging framework that ensures root cause identification before fixes. Use when encountering bugs, test failures, unexpected behavior, or when previous fix attempts failed. Enforces investigate-first discipline ('debug this', 'fix this error', 'test is failing', 'not working').
skill.summary: Four-phase debugging framework that ensures root cause identification before fixes. Use when encount...
skill.author: ArcadeAI

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill containing only markdown documentation with debugging methodology. No executable code, scripts, network calls, or file system access. Skill consists of instructional content guiding AI behavior during debugging tasks.

content.value_statement: Bugs keep returning because symptoms are fixed instead of root causes. This skill enforces a four-phase debugging framework that identifies the true source of issues before any fix attempts.
actual_capabilities: Guides four-phase debugging process: Root Cause Investigation, Pattern Analysis, Hypothesis Testing, Implementation
Enforces reading complete error messages and stack traces before attempting fixes
Teaches data flow tracing to identify where problems originate in call stacks
Prompts working code comparison to identify differences causing failures
Prevents premature fixes by enforcing single-change hypothesis testing
Flags architectural patterns that require deeper design review vs patching
limitations: Does not execute debugging commands or analyze code directly
Relies on user or AI to gather error details and system information
Cannot reproduce issues without provided reproduction steps
Does not fix bugs directly - only guides the investigation process

use_cases.title: Fix Recurring Bugs
use_cases.description: Investigate why bugs keep returning after multiple fix attempts by identifying the actual root cause

use_cases.title: Analyze Test Failures
use_cases.description: Trace test failures to their source using data flow analysis and working code comparison

use_cases.title: Debug Production Issues
use_cases.description: Apply systematic investigation to unexpected behavior in production systems under time pressure

prompt_templates.title: Basic Debug Request
prompt_templates.prompt: Debug this error: [paste error message]. Apply the four-phase debugging framework. Show your root cause investigation before proposing any fix.

prompt_templates.title: Failed Fix Follow-up
prompt_templates.prompt: I tried [previous fix approaches] but the issue persists. Use the debugging skill and return to Phase 1. What am I missing?

prompt_templates.title: Multi-Layer Investigation
prompt_templates.prompt: Debug this issue in our API ‚Üí Service ‚Üí Database system. The error occurs at [location]. Trace the data flow to find where bad data originates.

prompt_templates.title: Architectural Pattern Check
prompt_templates.prompt: We've attempted 3+ fixes that each revealed new problems. Apply Phase 4.5 - question architecture. Is this pattern sound or should we discuss refactoring?

output_examples.input: Debug this: My function sometimes returns undefined even though the data exists
output: Phase 1: Root Cause Investigation - examining error patterns and tracing data flow
Phase 2: Pattern Analysis - comparing with working implementations
Phase 3: Hypothesis Testing - testing theory about timing or null states
Phase 4: Implementation - creating failing test, fixing at source, verifying

best_practices: Always complete Phase 1 before any fix - understanding WHY matters more than quick solutions
Change ONE thing at a time during hypothesis testing to isolate what actually works
After 3+ failed fix attempts, question the architecture rather than continuing to patch
anti_patterns: Trying multiple fixes simultaneously - this makes it impossible to know what solved the problem
Fixing symptoms (where error appears) instead of root causes (where bad data originates)
Skipping error message analysis under time pressure - stack traces often contain the exact solution

faq.question: Which tools support this skill?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. It guides any AI assistant through systematic debugging methodology.

faq.question: How long does the process take?
faq.answer: Initial investigation takes longer than quick fixes, but prevents recurring bugs. Time spent upfront saves debugging time later.

faq.question: Can this integrate with my IDE?
faq.answer: This skill provides prompts you can use with any AI coding assistant. Integration depends on your specific IDE and AI setup.

faq.question: Is my code data sent anywhere?
faq.answer: No. This skill is purely prompt-based guidance. Code you share stays within your AI assistant's context only.

faq.question: What if I cannot reproduce the issue?
faq.answer: When reproduction is impossible, Phase 1 directs you to gather logs and historical data to infer patterns and potential causes.

faq.question: How is this different from regular debugging?
faq.answer: Traditional debugging often starts with fix attempts. This skill enforces investigation first, following the Iron Law: no fixes without root cause identification.
